title: Unreal Engine Environment Artist & Designer - Upwork
description: Advert: Unreal Engine Environment Artist & Designer Related Roles: Level Designer, World Artist, Overview A small team working on an online Medieval MMORPG game is looking for some experienced help to develop and expand the playable world! The project is in early-alpha stage with a live playable demo available on steam. It is an open world with semi-realistic art style inspiration (Elden Ring, Dark Souls, Witcher 3), using advanced Unreal Engine features. We would like to continue this development to refine and expand the playable space. About the Role: Together with our current team & community, you will be an experienced 3d artist responsible for creating the world the players adventures in. This includes (but is not limited to); Mocking level layouts Sculpting the landscape Creating and decorating gameplay areas (Towns, Fields, Caves, Dungeons) Creating & placing gameplay objects (NPCs, mineral veins, trees, forges) Editing 3D assets (as required) Creating Gameplay Assets (as required) You will be referencing the Design Documentation and existing work to gain an understanding of the game and the world, before using your creative energy to bring the world to life for the player around to see and explore in a way that synergises with the lore and gameplay mechanics. Your primary focus will be the world, but you may also be asked to help create gameplay assets (e.g. dress-up NPCs) or make specific modifications to assets. The core deliverables are versioned and playable Unreal Levels, detailed and filled with gameplay elements (gathering nodes, crafting stations, Quest NPCs, monsters etc.) that are performant and run well on modern PCs. You must have your own Windows-Based PC with minimum specs powerful enough to play the latest titles at high settings in order to view the game and effectively work with the PBR assets. About the Game: Order of the Elements is a challenging oldschool online RPG with modern graphics, dark themes and risk-reward themed gameplay. It takes inspiration from legends such as Zelda, Runescape, Elden Ring, World of Warcraft and entices players to explore an unforgiving open world. The game has a medieval 'Game of Thrones' theme; historical realism with hints of magic, unclear morals and dark elements. The game is in alpha development with a trailer, steam page and a playable demo which you can access via subscription https://store.steampowered.com/app/2617430/Order_of_the_Elements/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLbhj8jaWYM What you Get: You'll get to be a part of a technically challenging project with a fun, close-knit caring community working on a project who's primary ambition is to make a fun game with no pay-2-win. This is a contracted, remote, flexible role with part-time and full-time hours available. We welcome global applications, but require a regular 'overlap' time for meetings. Core Skills & Requirements: * High-End Desktop PC to work from * Unreal Generic Competency (navigation, blueprints, engine etiquette, asset management) * Unreal Deep Understanding of Level Building Concepts (Landscaping, foliage, lighting, LODs, shader complexity) * Experience working with Unreal advanced level features (World Partition, Nanite, Lumen) * Understanding of SDLC / GDLC * Experience playing at least 1 'MMORPG' style game * Good written and spoken English communication skills Nice to haves: * Experience using Perforce source control * Experience using heightmap generation tools (E.g. Gaea, World Map Generator) * Concept art / illustration skills * Good 3D asset creation/editing/skinning skills (creating small custom assets, editing marketplace assets) * Good understanding of 3D asset creation process and pipeline into Unreal * UK Timezone for meetings Commercial Notes: Role Type: Contract Duration: 3-6 months (with extension possibility) Hours: Flexible Working Compensation Rate: Candidate dependent If you are interested, please send a note introducing yourself with a CV, your hourly compensation expectations and a link to your portfolio If you have any questions about the role, please include it in your initial note. We will endeavor to respond to all applications, regardless of success. Thanks for reading, looking forward to hearing from you!Skills: Personal Computer, Microsoft Windows, Steam, Adventure, Action, Online Multiplayer, Ages 18+, Unreal Engine, 3D Design, 3D Rendering

title: VR App Developer for Meta Quest 3 - Upwork
description: We are seeking a skilled VR app developer who has experience building applications specifically for the Meta Quest 3. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of virtual reality technology and be familiar with the unique capabilities and limitations of the Meta Quest 3 platform. This project will involve designing and developing a VR app from scratch, including creating immersive environments, implementing interactive features, and optimizing performance for a seamless user experience. The most challenging part of this project is that we want to include a couple of (small) point clouds in the virtual environment. The processing of the point cloud can be done - either inside the headset, or if that's not possible due to hardware limitations, - using Azure Remote Rendering (ARR) App requirements: - Must be able to run independently on the MQ3, without pc connection. - At least 4 persons must be able to meet up in VR. They must be able to keep a voice conversation with each other. - Average framerate must be above 30 fps, and lag must never or very rarely occur. - App crashes should never occur in the finished app. VR environment The VR environment will consist of  5 parts that we will supply to the developer: - A mesh file in .ifc or .obj format that will represent a room in a building. In two smaller areas of the room, the mesh will be removed (void space). - For those two smaller areas, we will supply additional mesh files that fits. - For those two smaller areas, we will also supply point cloud files (.e57) that fits. - If necessary for performance, all surfaces can have a solid color (as opposed to being textured). VR content and functionality - In addition to the files mentioned above, we will also deliver around 10 smaller 3d-models in ifc format. The physical size of each of these will be less than 1x1x1 meters. These models must be placed on a blackboard or shelf in the VR-space. - The users must be able to pick up any of the smaller models and place them anywhere in the room. The models should not have gravity. E.g. if a model is placed in free air 1 meter above ground, it should stay there and not fall down. - When a user grabs one of the smaller models from the shelf, a new one should spawn within seconds. - All controls and inputs inside the app should be available from the hand controllers. - On the user's left hand there should be a popup menu with a few tools and settings: - 1. Toggle visibility on/off for all meshes, models and point clouds - 2. Measure distance in centimeters or millimeters between 2 points selected by a user - 3. Toggling between 2 modes of movement: "Flying" in the direction where the user points his right hand, and walking 1,8 meters above the VR-floor. The users should be able to fly through everything (no collision on them). - 4. Freehand drawing in 3d. - 5. Collectively exporting the models that have been placed out from the shelf as a single .ifc file. - All interactions in the VR environment must be visible for all users (e.g. if a user draws something, the other users should also see his drawing. If a user moves a model, the other users should see the movement). title: Fortnite creatif - Upwork
description: Game title: "Arcade Archers" Concept: In "Arcade Archers", children compete in an arena specially designed for archery. The game is simple, focused on friendly competition and mastery of archery. Game mechanics: Target Shooting: Children must aim and shoot at a series of targets located at different distances around the arena. Each target earns points based on its distance and size. Limited time: The game takes place over a limited period of time. Children must score as many points as possible before time runs out. Local Multiplayer: Kids can play local multiplayer, allowing multiple players to compete on the same console or split screen. Accuracy and Speed: The game rewards both precision and speed. Kids must aim precisely while shooting quickly to score as many points as possible. Game progress: Children enter the Arcade Archers arena and choose their starting location. Each round, targets appear in different locations around the arena. Children must aim and shoot at the targets to score points. At the end of each round, points are calculated and children can see who scored the most points. Objective: The objective of "Arcade Archers" is to provide a simple and fun gaming experience for children, where they can compete in archery challenges and test their skills against their friends in an environment competitive but friendly.Skills: C++, C#, JavaScript, Online Multiplayer, Unreal Engine, Unity, Game Development, Web Browser, Game Art, 3D Modeling, Senior Adult, Mobile Advertising

title: Unity IOS Developer to resolve the IOS issue. - Upwork
description: REQUIREMENT BREIF Project Overview: We are currently utilizing the "Addressable" Unity package within our project to facilitate the dynamic download and loading of scenes during runtime. This implementation allows for seamless user experience where scenes are downloaded and loaded concurrently while the application is in use. However, we have encountered a critical issue specifically related to iOS builds. When loading certain games from cache, the application crashes on iPhone devices. Upon investigation through the Xcode debugging portal, it has been identified that the crash is attributed to memory leaks. Applications details are mentioned below: Type of Asset: Mobile Domain: Gaming Category: Educational Audience: Kids (6-12 yrs) 1.Issue Description: 1.Crashes occurring on iOS devices when loading games from cache, with Xcode debugging portal indicating memory leaks. 2.Desired Outcome: 1.The Ensure that the application does not crash when users initiate gameplay loading from cache. 2.Prevent memory leaks during simultaneous background processes of game downloading and caching 3.Unity Engine: 1.The game should be developed using the Unity game development engine Version LTS 2020.3.26f1 Scope of Work: 1.Identification of Root Cause: Conduct a comprehensive analysis to identify the underlying cause of crashes and memory leaks occurring during gameplay loading from cache. 2.Implementation of Solutions: Develop and implement robust solutions to address the identified issues, ensuring stability and performance optimization. 3.Testing and Validation: Conduct rigorous testing across iOS devices to validate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and ensure seamless functionality without crashes or memory leaks. 4.Documentation and Reporting: Provide detailed documentation outlining the implemented solutions, testing procedures, and any additional recommendations for future enhancements. Proposal Requirements: 1.Experience and Expertise: Demonstrated experience and expertise in Unity development, particularly in addressing memory management issues and optimizing performance for iOS platforms. 2.Timeline: Provide a detailed timeline outlining key milestones and deliverables for the project, including estimated durations for analysis, development, testing, and documentation phases. 3.Cost Estimate: Submit a comprehensive cost estimate for the entire project, including breakdowns for analysis, development, testing, and documentation efforts. 4.References: Include references or case studies showcasing previous projects or experiences relevant to memory management optimization and stability enhancements in Unity for iOS. 4.Development Timeline: 1.Provide a detailed project timeline, including milestones and deadlines. 5.Testing and Quality Assurance: 1.Outline your testing and quality assurance processes to ensure a bug-free and polished final product. 2.Share a Unit Test report along with the build and sample of Unit test report will be shared by Techved. 6.Support and Updates:. 1.Detail the post-launch support and update plan for the game until and post Go-live.Skills: iOS, iOS Development, Smartphone, Mobile App Development

title: Python script to upload csv file to Firestore Collection - Upwork
description: Please build a python script that uploads the data in the attached csv file into our Firebase Firestore Collection called “known_UPC.” Formatting Notes * The UPC in column A should be the document name for each entry * The data should be uploaded to firestore such that subcategories from the csv file become subfields in Firestore * The firestore collection document with id 0851557003132 shows how the data should be formatted * Ensure the field types align with the field type index in the attached xlsx file. Script Logic Notes Set up the script so that when it is run, it detects changes and updates the data in Firestore. Specifically: * When new rows are added to the top of the sheet (row 4), re-running the script will add the new rows only (versus duplicating existing rows) * If any data in existing rows changes, re-running the script will update the data in those new rows (except the upc column, since I believe the document name cannot be changed after the fact) — but it will NOT duplicate the existing row * It should be easy for us to adjust the logic of the script to allow for additional columns if we choose to add them later The deliverable should be: * A working python script that we can continue to use * Instructions on how to run it (this can be in the form of an Upwork chat message, a loom or zoom call — whichever is easier for you) * Instructions on how to adjust the logic to allow for additional columns if we choose to add them later (again, feel free to share these instructions in whichever format is easiest for you)Skills: Python, Firebase Cloud Firestore, Scripting, Automation

title: Woocomerse Wordpress website slow +AWS+ubuntu - Upwork
description:
I need somebody to check my website. It looks slower than before, especially one page on it. One probable reason is heavy images on it. It may need optimization. But need to understand, if there is something else that is slowing it down.
It is on a WordPress website, hosted on AWS ubuntu Unix.
It was on t3a.medium, with 4GB memory. I upgraded it to t3a.large, with GB memory. Still after few days it stared crawling.
I can think of few of possibilities -
1) A quick https://WebPageTest.org run suggests either a significant memory shortage or mysqltuner requires to be run + SQL server tuned.
https://webpagetest.org/result/210127_Di9A_5b561dfae96aa3486e4fd8765f9e21ab/1/details/#waterfall_view_step1
2) If site speed is required, also ensure Opcache is enabled, then you tune Opcache to run &lt; 50% usages of key index memory + actual cache memory.
3) Its front is cloudflare. Sometimes it can slow the website and sometimes, it can speed up. Need to check this, if CDN helps.
4) CloudFlare SSL is almost always broken.
https://www.ssllabs.com/analyze.html?d=weink.studio&amp;latest shows that currently have a B score for this site, due completely to we're using CloudFlare SSL.
5) Visual Composer is being used, but it will be here. Can't see if there is any better alternate.
6) May be needs to do some combination of SQL tuning + Opcache tuning + WordPress caching so PHP processes start infrequently + complete quickly

title: Chat GPT - Excel Integration/API - Upwork
description: Interested in creating a GPT capable of directly editing and formatting Excel files. This is what I was told was needed: Creating a GPT capable of directly editing and formatting Excel files involves integrating the GPT with software or services that can manipulate Excel files programmatically, such as through an API or a scripting language like Python with libraries such as OpenPyXL or Pandas for Excel file manipulation. The capability you mentioned, as seen in the GPT created by "pulsr.co.uk", likely involves a backend system where the GPT serves as an interface to receive user requests, which are then processed by a backend service that performs the direct manipulation of Excel files. To create a GPT with similar capabilities, you would need to: Develop a Backend System: This system would handle file operations, including reading, writing, and modifying Excel files. It would use programming libraries that support Excel file manipulation. Integrate GPT with the Backend: The GPT would need to be integrated with this backend system, so it can interpret user requests and translate them into specific file operations. This might involve custom API endpoints that the GPT can call with parameters based on user input. Ensure Security and Privacy: When dealing with files that users upload, particularly sensitive data like contact information, it's crucial to implement robust security and privacy measures to protect user data. User Interface: For a seamless experience, you would also need to develop a user interface that allows users to upload files, input requests, and download the modified files. This UI would connect to the GPT and your backend system. While I can guide you on the concepts and steps required to create such a system, the actual development work involves programming and system architecture design that goes beyond what I can do for you directly. You might consider hiring a software developer or a team with experience in AI integration, web development, and data processing to build this system. If you're looking to learn how to do this yourself, starting with Python programming and familiarizing yourself with libraries for Excel manipulation and web development (for API creation) would be a good foundation. Additionally, learning about integrating AI models into applications would give you the necessary skills to bring your vision to life.Skills: Python, Google Apps Script, JavaScript, Google Cloud Platform, OCR Algorithm, Visual Basic, Apps Script API, Google Chrome Extension, Google Forms, Google Sheets, Google APIs, MySQL, Visual Basic for Applications, Excel Macros, ChatGPT, ChatGPT API Integration

title: BCI Research Data API Development for a Deeptech Company - Upwork
description: Project Overview: We seek talented developers to create and manage a scalable, secure API for a Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) study. This API will collect, store, and retrieve data from a device application that records 3D hand locations, EEG data, and experiment specifics. The data will be used to understand the relationship between brain activity and hand movements. Roles: Server Architect: Will be consulted for designing and building the server infrastructure, ensuring scalability, security, and reliability. Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and knowledge of secure API design is essential. Python Server Developer: Will develop and maintain the API using Python, implementing endpoints for data upload, retrieval, and metadata access. Expertise in RESTful APIs, JSON data handling, OAuth, and database integration is required. Responsibilities: Server Architect: Design and implement a secure and scalable server infrastructure. Select and configure appropriate cloud services. Implement authentication and authorization mechanisms. Monitor and maintain server performance and security.   Python Server Developer: Develop and maintain RESTful API endpoints using Python and appropriate libraries. Implement data validation and error handling. Integrate with a database for data storage and retrieval. Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code. Technical Skills: Server Architect: Experience with cloud platforms Familiarity with secure API design principles Knowledge of networking and security best practices Python Server Developer: Proficiency in Python and relevant libraries Experience with RESTful API development Understanding of JSON data format Knowledge of database integration Desired Experience: Experience with similar research projects and data collection platforms Strong communication and collaboration skills Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks Able to implement a versioning system to manage potential changes and maintain compatibility. Experience providing comprehensive API documentation with examples, code snippets, and diagrams. Experience establishing a clear process for updating documentation and API functionalities. Additional Info:: Data Format: - General structure: JSON object containing timestamped data points (EEG). - Timestamp: Unix epoch time format (milliseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z). - Hand positions: Described by a specific format (e.g. XYZ coordinates, joint angles, finger data (separate from hand position XYZ)). - EEG Data Representation: Raw Values Server Mechanics: - API type: RESTful API with standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, etc.). - Authentication: OAuth 2.0 or similar secure method for user identification and authorization. Endpoints: - /upload: For uploading synchronized data from the device application. - /query: For retrieving specific data sets based on labels and filters. - To prove that you’ve read the whole job post please add the phrase BCI rocks at the beginning of your application, otherwise it will not be considered. - /metadata: For accessing experiment information and available data. - Response format: JSON objects with status codes and relevant data or error messages. - Error handling: Well-defined error codes and descriptions for troubleshooting, label application errors, server errors, and user-initiated application errors (e.g. user closes the app mid-game, resulting in data not being saved).  Skills: Database Architecture, Software Architecture & Design, RESTful API, Python, API, Data Analysis, JSON, OAuth, Database Integration

title: Chatting app  - Upwork
description: Creating an app that combines the functionalities of WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat with the best design practices requires careful planning and execution. Here are some steps you can take: 1. **Define Your Unique Selling Proposition (USP)**: Determine what sets ChromaChat apart from existing messaging apps. Is it a specific feature, a unique design approach, or a combination of both? Clarify your USP to guide your design and development efforts. 2. **User Research**: Conduct thorough user research to understand the needs, preferences, and pain points of your target audience. Identify what they like and dislike about existing messaging apps to inform your design decisions. 3. **Feature Prioritization**: Decide which features from WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat you want to incorporate into ChromaChat. Prioritize the most essential ones and consider how they can be seamlessly integrated into the app's design. 4. **Design Exploration**: Experiment with different design concepts and visual styles to find the best fit for ChromaChat. Consider factors such as color schemes, typography, iconography, and overall layout. Aim for a design that is both visually appealing and intuitive to use. 5. **User Interface (UI) Design**: Create a clean and user-friendly interface that prioritizes ease of navigation and accessibility. Pay attention to details such as button placement, menu organization, and interaction feedback. 6. **Interaction Design**: Design smooth and intuitive interactions that make it easy for users to perform common tasks such as sending messages, sharing media, and managing contacts. Incorporate gestures and animations where appropriate to enhance the user experience. 7. **Privacy and Security**: Given the sensitive nature of messaging apps, prioritize privacy and security in your design. Implement robust encryption, authentication, and permission controls to protect users' data and communication. 8. **Testing and Iteration**: Conduct usability testing with real users to gather feedback on the app's design and functionality. Use this feedback to iterate and refine the design, addressing any usability issues or pain points that arise. 9. **Accessibility**: Ensure that ChromaChat is accessible to users with disabilities by following accessibility best practices in design and development. This includes providing alternative text for images, keyboard navigation support, and compatibility with screen readers. 10. **Launch and Marketing**: Once the app is ready, plan a strategic launch and marketing campaign to attract users and generate buzz. Highlight ChromaChat's unique features and design elements to differentiate it from competing messaging apps. By following these steps and incorporating the best design practices from WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat, you can create ChromaChat—an innovative messaging app that offers a seamless user experience and stands out in the crowded messaging market.Skills: RxSwift, Firebase Cloud Firestore, iOS, Apple Xcode, iPadOS, watchOS, iOS Development, In-App Purchases, Flutter, iAd, WatchKit, iOS SDK, iPad App Development, Objective-C, Swift, Firebase

title: API Video Delivery Update Needed - Upwork
description: Currently, our Slack app is set up to deliver remote video content from Firebase to Slack. The preview shows up in the app Messages tab (see video recording attached). A user will select play, and then the video opens up in a new browser window. The video preview is then removed from the Slack messages tab after the video is done. We are accomplishing this using the remote file API provided by Slack. However, we want the video to be played directly within our Slack app. We do not want the user to have to leave their Slack workspace to view our videos. I reached out to Slack support. They said this should be possible, and that we should use Slack Video blocks to stream the content directly from our Firebase service, instead of uploading the content to Slack using Remote Files. title: Looking for Full Stack Developer (Portuguese Speaker) - Upwork
Equote form and database - Upwork
description: Project Title: Equote ShipWise Logistics 1. Project Overview The EQUOTE aims to provide a seamless experience for users to request shipping quotes, view their quote history, and obtain tailored information based on their specific origin/destination location and commodities. The system will support manual and automatic calculation of shipping rates, insurance rates, and accessorial charges. If system can generate the rate, then user can receive the rate immediately. If it doesn't exist then admin have to be notified and manually calculate the costing. 2. Functional Requirements 2.1 User Account Management Registration: Users/Admin can register by providing necessary information (e.g., name, email, password). Authentication is required Login/Logout: Secure authentication system to access user-specific data. Profile Management: Users can update their profile information, and only the origin / destination locations they added. (user cannot add / edit locations created by admin (Admin should be able to control if user can edit locations/commodities) 2.2 Quote Requests Form Submission: Users can submit requests for quotes through an interactive form, specifying details such as origin location, destination, commodity type, weight, and dimensions. Quote Calculation: The system calculates rates based on user input, and pre-defined logic for shipping, insurance, and accessorial charges. IF doesn't exist allows admin to manually calculate the rates. Quote History: Users can view their past quote requests and their statuses. 2.3 Location and Commodity Information Dynamic Content: Based on the user’s assigned origin location, display relevant commodities and information. Database Updates: Admins can update location and commodity data as needed. 3. System Architecture 3.1 Frontend Technologies: wordpress, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and a modern JavaScript framework (e.g., React, Vue.js). Responsive Design: Ensure the application is accessible on various devices and screen sizes. Interactive Forms: Design forms for user input with real-time validation. Searching: All grids needs to be able to sort/filter/search 3.2 Backend Framework: Use a robust backend framework (current website on wordpress). Authentication: Implement JWT (JSON Web Tokens) or OAuth for secure authentication. API Development: RESTful APIs to handle requests between the frontend and backend. 3.3 Database Design RDBMS: Use a relational database management system (e.g., MySQL or other ) to store user data, quote information, location, and commodity details. Schema Design: Refer to user/admin tabs in attach excel file 4. Calculation Logic Shipping Rates: create a table based on origin to destination Define rules and algorithms based on zipcode origin to zipcode destination, weight, and commodity type. Insurance Rates: Calculate based on commodity value and location additional insurance required rate Accessorial Charges: Additional charges based on specific requirements 5. Express.js (if using Node.js): A minimalist web application framework for Node.js, simplifying backend development. Database: MongoDB or PostgreSQL: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that can handle unstructured data well. PostgreSQL is a powerful relational database management system suitable for complex data relationships. Server: Nginx or Apache: These web servers can handle HTTP requests efficiently, providing a stable environment for the application. Authentication: JWT (JSON Web Tokens): Secure and efficient for user authentication and authorization. Mapping and Location Services: Google Maps API or Mapbox API: Integration with these APIs allows for mapping functionalities, including property location display and nearby amenities. Messaging: Socket.io (for real-time features): Enables real-time communication between users. Payment Gateway: Stripe or PayPal: For handling secure online transactions. Cloud Hosting: AWS (Amazon Web Services) or Heroku: Both provide scalable and reliable cloud infrastructure. Version Control: Git: Essential for collaborative development and code versioning. Containerization and Orchestration: Docker and Kubernetes (optional): Useful for deploying and managing containerized applications. Security: SSL/TLS: To ensure secure data transfer over the internet. OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) best practices: Implementing security measures to protect against common web application vulnerabilities. The project focuses on enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of 24h hotlines and crisis lines nationwide by offering innovative software solutions for issues like high-volume caller management, integrated scheduling and call-routing, staff burnout protection, and multi-lingual support. It involves close collaboration with crisis line coordinators to tailor and implement a customized system that meets the unique needs of their organizations, while continuously developing and providing access to new features for their community of users This role includes an opportunity to grow as a Team Lead in the future. title: Compounding Formula Management System Web Application Development (.Net Full Stack Development) - Upwork
description: Project Medisca develops a tool to address the Compounding Services needs of the chemists, pharmacists, and sales representatives. The goal is to capture the formula requests from the customers, to provide a tool for the chemist to produce the formula with all the ingredients and references needed. The formula must follow the approval process before being sent to the customer and published on our website. This web application with be our Formula Management System. Mission Your mission is to collaborate with our internal development team to extend the workforce. You will work on an application REST API based using .Net Core with an MS SQL database. You will also work on the web application using Blazor and the Syncfusion library. All the requirements are documented in Jira user stories which must be delivered in 2 weeks sprints. The user stories follow the three c’s principle. The code is versioned in GitHub and the implementation must follow the gitflow. This mission is planned for 8 weeks of 35h (current estimation, can be revised). Your mission could be extended if you are able to migrate the application on the Azure Cloud using the web application template. Currently the application is hosted on our on-premises servers. Environment Medisca is a global corporation leveraging strong partnerships to serve healthcare professionals across diverse wellness disciplines. Offering extensive and essential solutions - including pharmaceutical ingredients and service, mixing technology manufacturing, analytical testing, and education – Medisca is bridging the gaps in healthcare with an unwavering commitment to precision, innovation, and societal impact. You will collaborate with the IT team on an Agile project. Your main contacts will be the other developers, the business analyst, the product owner and solution architects. Medisca is in constant growth and digital initiatives are increasing each year. So, be ready to have more than one opportunity in case of great collaboration. Profile We are looking for a web application expert. Someone curious about the technology and the project, with the desire to collaborate. Skills: Microsoft SQL Server, Azure DevOps, Microsoft Azure, .NET Core, Blazor, Syncfusion, C#

title: Software Developer - EHR and Client Management System - Upwork
description: Description: We are seeking an experienced and innovative software developer to design and develop a comprehensive Electronic Health Records (EHR) and Client Management System for our nonprofit organization. This proprietary software will serve as a crucial tool in managing our operations, enhancing client care, and improving organizational efficiency. Responsibilities: Collaborate with our team to understand the specific needs and requirements of our organization in terms of electronic health records and client management. Design and develop a user-friendly EHR system that integrates seamlessly with our existing workflows and processes. Develop a client management system that enables efficient tracking of client information, service plans, and progress. Implement cloud-based and server-based solutions to ensure accessibility, security, and scalability of the software. Customize the software to allow for easy data input, retrieval, and analysis, including the ability to pull metrics and data for quality improvement purposes. Create automated features for generating spreadsheets, graphs, and reports to visualize and analyze data. Ensure the software complies with relevant regulations and standards for data privacy and security in the healthcare industry. Develop mobile applications to provide on-the-go access to key features of the EHR and client management system. Requirements: Proven experience in developing EHR systems, client management systems, and cloud-based software solutions. Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#. Familiarity with healthcare data standards and protocols, such as HL7 and FHIR. Strong understanding of user interface design principles and user experience optimization. Ability to work independently and collaboratively, with excellent communication skills. Experience with integrating third-party APIs and services, such as payment gateways and patient portals, is a plus. Also API for A.I Knowledge of other EHR systems such as Epic, Meditech, and Cerner for benchmarking and comparison purposes. Additional Details: • Project Timeline: The project is expected to have an estimated duration of six months or less with milestones to be defined in collaboration with the selected candidate. • Preferred Qualifications: Experience or familiarity with nonprofit or healthcare software development is preferred but not required. •         Communication Channels: Regular communication and updates will be facilitated through Slack Skype or upwork communication channels, including • Portfolio or Samples: Candidates are encouraged to provide samples of previous work or portfolio showcasing their experience in developing similar software solutions. Budget: The budget for this project is negotiable based on the scope and complexity of the software development. Please provide your hourly rate or project-based estimate when applying. Nondisclosure Agreement: All applicants will be required to sign a nondisclosure agreement (NDA) to protect the confidentiality of our proprietary software and intellectual property. If you are a talented and innovative software developer with experience in developing EHR systems and client management software, we encourage you to apply. Help us revolutionize the way we deliver care and support to our community. title: System Integration, UI/UX and infographic Designer - Upwork
description: We are seeking a talented system integration expert to analyze multiple systems and ideas and convert them into one integrated system. The ideal candidate will have strong skills in flowcharting, UI/UX design, and infographic creation. You will be responsible for developing a comprehensive flowchart that outlines the integration process and visually represents how the systems will interact. Project Overview: This project is extensive, enjoyable, and holds significant value for a large portion of the Medina population. Currently, no party has embraced the ideas I am presenting, and I lack the resources for it, relying on initiatives from like-minded colleagues. Consequently, I've taken the initiative to launch it through a personal website, with no current funding in place. Our goal is to utilize the project's outputs for presentations aimed at attracting development projects and securing the involvement of official bodies, investors, and various beneficiaries. The development project focuses on services related to the preparation, packaging, marketing, and export of agricultural crops, along with the coordination with other sectors, resources, and services. Our plan is to progressively develop its programming in the upcoming stages. Confidentiality and Communication: We emphasize the importance of maintaining confidentiality regarding commercial information associated with the project. Once an offer is submitted, it implies implicit approval and commitment to these confidentiality provisions. Communication will primarily occur through live audio and remote online meetings to ensure efficiency and effectiveness during this stage of the project. Project Scope: Our objective is to transform a set of information, processes, procedures, and systems into one integrated system through systems analysis. We aim to visualize the idea through a process flow chart, UX/UI design, and the integration of all elements into a comprehensive panel. The work involves: 1. Creating a complete process flow chart (UML). 2. Designing UX for all orders. 3. Designing UI for the home page, main section pages, and reports. 4. Merging all above elements (1,2, and 3) into one panel representing the integrated system. 5. Ensuring the templates and pages resemble the real system closely, without programming. Targeted Categories: The project involves various categories, including farmers, farms, crops, merchants, enterprises, suppliers, visitors, buyers, shipping, electronic stock exchange, agricultural materials market, agricultural services market, warehouses, trainers, consultants, and students. Design Details: The designer will receive identity and color guidelines but is responsible for collecting innovative images and icons systematically. The visuals will focus on representing the system without actual users or a control panel, providing a realistic visual representation for presentation purposes. Expected Outputs: The desired outputs include analyzing the system, creating a cloud of elements and their relationships, representing them with flowcharts and UML, producing interfaces for the entire platform, and providing digital, editable copies of source programs. All outputs should be arranged for use in presentations or videos, with the target language being English. Presentation and Collaboration: The project will be presented using Prezi, and the designer's role involves collecting the latest and best design to achieve the most effective representation. We'll collaborate on an unconventional approach to create a map of the development project system and its positive effects. Future Editing: It is essential for the designer to provide all source files to facilitate future editing as the project progresses through different stages.Skills: Web Development, WordPress, Graphic Design, Adobe Illustrator, UI/UX Prototyping, Systems Modeling, User Experience Design, User Interface Design, UML Diagram

title: Looking for a skilled web designer to help us refresh our cloud training website  - Upwork
description: We are a cloud computing training provider offering online courses and virtual bootcamps. Our website serves as a vital resource for current and future students. This project is a three-phase website revamp focused on improving user experience and visual consistency. Phase 1: Learnworlds Design Review (Back-End): Our online courses are hosted on the LearnWorlds (SaaS) platform. We need your expertise to review the look and feel of the LearnWorlds learning management system (LMS) and suggest design improvements. A staging environment can be used for performing the review. Phase 2: Wordpress Website Review (Front-End): Our main website is built on Wordpress (currently using the BuddyBoss theme) and showcases our course offerings, blog posts, and other marketing content. We want to create visual consistency between the LearnWorlds platform and our Wordpress pages. This involves identifying a new Wordpress theme that closely mirrors the design elements of the revamped LearnWorlds LMS. Website Performance is of utmost importance when selecting a new theme. Phase 3: Implement Design Changes (Front-End and Back-End): Implement the design updates to the LearnWorlds LMS and WordPress front-end. This will involve working with our technical team as we migrate to a new hosting provider and new WordPress installation for the front-end. Responsibilities: You'll be working collaboratively with us to understand our brand identity and user needs. Phase 1: Refine the design of the Learnworlds student portal. This includes customization of the user interface, navigation, and visual elements (definition of colors, fonts, etc.). Phase 2: Identify or customize a new Wordpress theme that closely matches the revamped Learnworlds design. Ensure responsive design across all devices (desktop, tablet, mobile). title: World Coin Off-Ramp Integration with M-Pesa - Upwork
description: 1. Introduction:    - This document outlines the requirements for developing a software solution that facilitates the conversion of World Coin to Kenyan Shillings (KES) using M-Pesa as the payment gateway. The system aims to provide a seamless off-ramp for users to cash out their World Coin holdings into KES. 2. Functional Requirements:    2.1 User Registration and Authentication:    - Users should be able to register accounts securely on the platform.    - Authentication mechanisms should be implemented to ensure user identity verification.    2.2 World Coin Deposit:    - Users should have the ability to deposit World Coin into their accounts on the platform.    - The system should generate unique deposit addresses for each user.   2.3 M-Pesa Integration:    - Integration with M-Pesa API to facilitate the transfer of KES to users' M-Pesa accounts.    - Users should be able to link their M-Pesa accounts to the platform for seamless transactions.    2.4 Currency Conversion:    - Implement real-time currency conversion from World Coin to KES based on prevailing exchange rates.    - Ensure transparency in conversion fees and rates.    2.5 Automated Transaction Processing:    - Develop an automated system for processing transactions, minimizing manual intervention.    - The system should calculate and deduct platform commission fees automatically.    2.6 Admin Panel:    - Provide an admin panel for managing user accounts, transactions, and commission rates.    - Admins should have the ability to adjust commission rates and other variables as needed. 3. Non-Functional Requirements:    3.1 Security:    - Implement robust security measures to protect user data and transactions.    - Use encryption protocols to secure sensitive information.    3.2 Scalability:    - Design the system to handle a large volume of transactions and users as the platform grows.    - Ensure scalability by utilizing cloud-based infrastructure and scalable architecture.    3.3 Reliability:    - The system should be highly reliable, minimizing downtime and ensuring continuous availability.    - Implement monitoring tools to detect and address any issues promptly.    3.4 Performance:    - Ensure fast transaction processing times to provide a seamless user experience.    - Optimize system performance to handle peak loads efficiently. 4. Technical Requirements:    4.1 Technology Stack:    - Choose appropriate programming languages, frameworks, and databases for development.    - Consider factors such as compatibility, scalability, and security.    4.2 API Integration:    - Integrate with World Coin APIs for deposit processing and currency conversion.    - Integrate with M-Pesa APIs for fund transfers and payment processing.    4.3 Compliance:    - Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements governing cryptocurrency transactions and financial services in Kenya. 5. User Interface (UI) Requirements:    5.1 User-Friendly Interface:    - Design an intuitive and user-friendly interface for easy navigation and interaction.    - Ensure compatibility with various devices and screen sizes.    5.2 Transaction History:    - Provide users with access to their transaction history for transparency and record-keeping purposes. 6. Future Enhancements:    - Consider potential future enhancements such as support for additional cryptocurrencies, integration with other payment gateways, and expansion to other markets beyond Kenya. 7. Conclusion:    - This requirements document provides a comprehensive overview of the functionality, technical specifications, and user interface requirements for developing a software solution that enables the conversion of World Coin to Kenyan Shillings using M-Pesa. By adhering to these requirements, the platform aims to provide a seamless and efficient off-ramp for World Coin users in Kenya.Skills: Website Security, API, UX & UI Design

title: Zephyr Embedded Developer for RP2040 RS232 IOT Device - Upwork
description: Console Pro is looking for a talented embedded developer proficient and experienced with developing on the Zypher RTOS on MicroControllers including RP2040 Pico and MIMXRT Crossover MCU's such as the RT1060 and RT1170 series We need a simple firmware application developed that will support LWIP, boot up and obtain a DHCP address and obtain the time via NTP and connect to a secure websocket via TLS 1.2 by URL. The URL to establish a websocket is obtained via JSON RESTful API Query to a url including the local SN of the device, MAC Address and timestamp. The API will respond with a server DNS name to use to establish a websocket to. The device will perform mutual certificate authentication to establish a WebSocket and upon initial establishment send a summary json query of device parameters including firmware version, active firmware, mac address, serial number and if the device is being powered via PoE. The websocket server will utilize ping/pong mechanism for keepalives every 10 seconds and disconnect the socket after 30 seconds dead time. The websocket will be used for all communication such as command traffic and uart serial traffic to be encapsulated within json. The commands are reset, uart paramter update, and uart session start/stop. The firmware will support a simple LLDP functionality which will advertise the current firmware version, serial number, ip address and device model to the connected switch. It should also receive LLDP and/or CDP frames and relay that information via the websocket in JSON format which will be displayed via cloud dashboard. A subroutine must check the NTP time every 4 hours to verify accuracy and sync time if necessary. The primary function of the application is to serve as a Websocket UART bridge. The firmware will be running the RP2040 which is on a board powered via PoE and has a single RS232 shifter connected to UART1. The firmware must be able to set the variables for the UART on demand when receiving a command via JSON from the WebSocket server. For example, the WebSocket server tells the device to change the buad rate from 9600 to 115200 bps. OTA firmware update support is required and must be triggered via command from the WebSocket server, this is due to customers wanting to schedule the update time during a period that would be non-impacting. This firmware OTA update mechanism must use a secondary bootloader such as MCUBoot to facilitate OTA on the 16MB Flash chip which will be partitioned accordingly. Development is to take place on the W5500-EVK-PICO board and the software will be adapted to run on the production product board when prototypes are available. Additional details can be provided during interviews.Skills: Embedded System, Embedded C, Microcontroller Programming, SSL, JSON, Websockets

title: Development and Testing of a Text Translation Script on Google Colab - Upwork
description: Project Description: We are seeking a skilled developer to assist in deploying and testing a Python script on Google Colab that automates the translation of text files from English to Chinese. The script will need to handle multiple text files organized within different folders, translating each file's contents and saving the translated versions in corresponding folders while maintaining the original directory structure. Key Project Requirements: Script Development: Develop a Python script that can: Upload multiple English text files (.txt format) organized in different folders to Google Colab. Translate the content of each text file from English to Chinese using the OpenAI API. Save the translated text files in their corresponding folders with the same directory structure as the original. OpenAI API Integration: Integrate the script with OpenAI's translation service. The developer will need to ensure efficient use of the API to manage costs and abide by rate limits. Testing and Optimization: Thoroughly test the script with various sizes and structures of text files to ensure reliability and accuracy of the translations. The script should be optimized for efficient API use and error handling. Documentation: Provide detailed documentation on how to use the script, including steps for setting up the OpenAI API key, uploading files to Google Colab, and downloading the translated files. Support and Revisions: Offer support for any bugs or issues encountered during the initial use and make necessary revisions to address any functional shortcomings identified. Skills and Experience Required: Proficiency in Python programming, specifically with experience in developing scripts for Google Colab. Experience with API integration, preferably with OpenAI or similar text translation services. Strong understanding of file and directory manipulation in a cloud-based environment. Ability to write clear, concise documentation for technical procedures. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. For your infomation ### Step 1: Open Google Colab and Create a New Notebook Go to [Google Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/), log in with your Google account, and then create a new notebook. ### Step 2: Install the OpenAI Library In a new code cell, input and run the following command to install the OpenAI library: ```python !pip install openai ``` ### Step 3: Upload Files Since Google Colab runs in the cloud, you need to upload the text files you want to translate into the Colab environment. This can be done through Colab's file upload feature: - In the notebook's sidebar, click the "Files" icon. - Click the "Upload to session storage" button and select your text files to upload. ### Step 4: Set the API Key and Adjust the Code In a code cell, set your OpenAI API key, and adjust the script according to your needs. Make sure you have uploaded the files to Colab and correctly set the `source_folder` and `target_folder` variables to reflect paths in the Colab environment. ```python import os import openai # Set the OpenAI API key openai.api_key = 'Your API Key' # Ensure the following function definitions remain unchanged def translate_text(text, source_lang="en", target_lang="zh"):     ... def translate_files_in_folder(source_folder, target_folder):     ... # Adapt paths for the Colab environment source_folder = '/content/source' # Assuming you have uploaded files to this folder target_folder = '/content/translated' translate_files_in_folder(source_folder, target_folder) ``` ### Step 5: Download the Translated Files After the translation is completed, you can view the translated files in the `target_folder` by clicking the "refresh" button under the "Files" icon on the left sidebar. Right-click on a file or folder and select "Download" to download the file or the entire folder to your local computer.Skills: Python

Since the dataset is very large, there are many deficiencies of running column generation for such a big data every week. The deliverable of this project is to convert this whole process into a high-quality academic research writing. I can provide my current brief writing, but my current writing is just a write-up of the basics to solve the business case, not suitable for serious academic purposes. Some basic requirements: 1. Able to write high quality academic paper. Attached sample is the expected quality of writing. 2. Have published optimization related work, or have been trained as a PhD in this field, or currently pursuing a PhD in related field. 3. Know machine learning and big data analytics. 4. Able to simulate the optimization algorithm using synthetic data (just a portion of the weekly data if you don’t have access to cloud computing power) and compare cost savings between your tailored algorithm and the classic column generation approach. 5. Able to provide code in Python. I will provide a sample weekly data and the related cost and other assumptions needed for the optimization to run. I can share more details during our project kickoff meeting. Project Stages: 1. Stage 1 (8 weeks): Start to finish within 8 weeks. Please kindly ensure you can finish this within 8 weeks. 80% payment after Stage 1 is signed off by both parties. 2. Stage 2 (4 weeks): Major or minor revisions to the work from Stage 1 to be done within 4 weeks. title: Create a program for use on the Unreal Engine - Upwork
description: Write a program that allows the user to ask any of 3 questions using their voice and the program will deliver the correct video answer from one of three video files. I need to stream this program. Preferably from an Unreal engine server.  We already have the 3 videos.  Is this something you are good at? Here's how Copilot solved this issue:  COPILOT: Creating a program that responds to voice input and streams video files from an Unreal Engine server involves several steps. Let’s break it down: Setting Up the Video Files: First, you’ll need three video files with the correct answers. Make sure they are in a compatible format (such as .mp4, .mov, or .flv). Store these video files in a location accessible by your Unreal Engine project. Unreal Engine Setup: Create a new Unreal Engine project or use an existing one. In the Content Browser, create a new folder called “Media” inside the Content folder. Right-click inside the empty Media folder, select “Stream Media Source,” and name the asset (e.g., “MediaStream”). Open the MediaStream asset and enter the desired stream URL (direct link to your video file). Create a Media Player asset (e.g., “MyPlayer”) and enable video output with a linked Media Texture asset. Associate the Media Texture asset with the Media Player. Voice Input Integration: Implement voice recognition using a library or service (such as Google Speech-to-Text or Microsoft Azure Speech Service). Capture the user’s voice input and convert it to text. Answer Selection Logic: Based on the recognized question, determine which video file corresponds to the correct answer. You can use a simple switch statement or more sophisticated logic to map questions to video files. Streaming the Video: Use Unreal Engine’s media framework to play the selected video. Apply the Media Texture to a UI element (e.g., a fullscreen widget) or even a Static Mesh (like a TV screen) in your level. Start streaming the video using the Media Player. Server Setup: If you want to stream from an Unreal Engine server, consider using Unreal Engine’s Pixel Streaming feature. Pixel Streaming allows you to run your Unreal Engine application on a cloud server and stream rendered frames and audio to browsers and mobile devices over WebRTC 1. Testing and Deployment: Test your program locally to ensure voice recognition, video selection, and streaming work correctly. Deploy your Unreal Engine project to your desired server (local or cloud-based).Skills: Unreal Engine, C++, Python

description: We require the structural design of a hydraulic weir for a river deviation project. We have already done the hydraulic analysis and flood plain simulations. description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. description: The project involves developing two interconnected databases to manage and analyze lead and conversion data from various sources, including landing pages and affiliate dashboards. It includes fields for tracking whether certain actions (like email sent or pixel fired) have been performed, with these fields updating based on external automation. This database will integrate with the main databases to provide a comprehensive view of campaign performance, including metrics like add to cart, checkout, purchase rates, and ROI analysis across various levels (campaign, ad set, ad). The goal is to enable detailed analysis and reporting on the effectiveness of advertising campaigns, from spending to conversions, allowing for a deeper understanding of income versus outcome at multiple levels of granularity. title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience  DR160 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: Logistics Coordination, Price & Quote Negotiation, Request for Quotation, Request for Information, Request for Proposal, Supplier Search, Factory & Supplier Auditing, Product Sourcing, Quality Inspection, Buying, IT Sourcing, Procure-to-Pay, Source-to-Pay, Source-to-Contract

title: Flutter VoIP Mobile App Agora or ConnectyCube - Upwork
description: Address the issue of requiring users to log in every time an incoming call is received when the app is in the background, you can use a combination of: silent push notifications to wake the app and securely store the user's session or token to automatically log them in. This way, the app can bypass the login screen and directly display the incoming call screen. Here's a step-by-step guide to implementing this in your Flutter app for Android: 1. Securely Store User Session or Token After the user's initial login, securely store the session or token using Flutter's shared_preferences package or a more secure storage solution like flutter_secure_storage. 2. Wake the App with Silent Push Notifications Use Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) to send a high-priority, silent push notification to the device when there is an incoming call. Ensure that the notification data payload includes a flag indicating that it's for an incoming call. 3. Handle Silent Push Notifications in Background Create a background message handler in your main.dart or a relevant file that listens for incoming FCM messages and checks if it's a call notification. 4. Automatically Authenticate and Show Incoming Call Screen Before showing the incoming call UI, check if the user's token/session is stored. If so, use it to automatically authenticate the user with ConnectyCube, bypassing the login screen. CoonnectyCude or Agora is preferred Remember to replace placeholder methods like ConnectyCubeManager.authenticateWithToken with actual implementation code for authenticating with ConnectyCube using the stored token. THE CALL SCREENS WERE DESIGNED IN FIGMA AND READY FOR PRODUCTION, WE ONLY REQUIRE RESOLUTION OF THIS ISSUE.Skills: Flutter, Agora Video SDK, Agora Voice SDK, Push Notifications

title: Virtual Assistant for Pet Store - Upwork
description: We are a Singapore-based pet shop deeply committed to ethical breeding and the well-being of puppies. This role primarily involves managing digital content, updating records, and maintaining communication with clients. Preferred Skills and Qualifications: - A genuine love for dogs and an interest in ethical breeding practices. - Strong organizational skills and proficiency in handling digital data (photos, videos, cloud storage). - Experience with Airtable or similar data management tools like Excel. - Excellent written communication skills for effective customer interaction and preparation of care sheets. - Ability to work independently in a remote setting. Application Requirements: Please submit your portfolio showcasing your experience in digital organization or related fields. While not mandatory, preference will be given to candidates with experience in pet-related projects or virtual assistance roles involving similar tasks. We look forward to welcoming a dedicated and dog-loving individual to our team!Skills: Canva, Virtual Assistance, Administrative Support, Customer Service, Personal Administration

title: Javascript / REST / Postgres API Backend Developer - Upwork
description: We have been slowly building an equipment management platform for a bit over 2 years.
