title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience  DR145 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: Electrical Design, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Layout Design, Load Calculation, Power Distribution, Piping & Instrumentation Diagram, CAD, Wiring Design, Lighting Design

title: Backend Developer Needed for  Mental Health AI Application - Upwork
description: Job Description: We are at the forefront of a mental health care revolution with our pioneering web application, Baseline, designed to change the lives of individuals with bipolar disorder. Our application leverages AI-driven predictive analytics and personalized care plans to offer unparalleled support. We're in search of a highly skilled and passionate Backend Developer to bring our project to the next level on a freelance basis. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing scalable, high-performance backend systems and a fervent interest in utilizing the latest technologies to overcome the unique challenges faced in the mental health tech arena. Project Finalize the integration of our existing database with the web application, ensuring smooth data flow and real-time synchronization. Architect and refine scalable backend services, APIs, and database structures using Python, Node.js, and frameworks such as Django, Flask, and Express.js, with a specific focus on secure and efficient handling of sensitive health data. Collaborate closely with our frontend team and data scientists to ensure seamless integration of user-facing elements with server-side logic, optimizing the performance and responsiveness of our mental health predictive analytics application. Uphold the integrity, privacy, and security of health data, adhering strictly to HIPAA, GDPR, and other relevant data protection regulations, implementing best practices in data encryption, secure data transfer, and storage. Proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and security vulnerabilities, developing robust solutions to these challenges. Participate in code reviews, promote a culture of excellence, and facilitate knowledge sharing within the team to stimulate continuous advancement. Keep abreast of the latest trends and technologies in backend development, particularly within health tech, to ensure our application employs the most effective and cutting-edge solutions available. Requirements: Demonstrable backend development experience with a robust portfolio of projects, particularly those within the health tech sector or related fields. Proficiency in Python and Node.js, with substantial experience in frameworks like Django, Flask, and Express.js. A thorough understanding of MongoDB and RESTful API development is critical. Solid knowledge of database systems, especially those adept at managing large-scale, sensitive data (e.g., MongoDB, MySQL). Experience with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud Platform) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is highly valued. Exceptional problem-solving skills, meticulous attention to detail, and a strong commitment to data security and privacy. Outstanding communication and teamwork abilities, with a history of successful collaborations in remote settings. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is preferred, coupled with a passion for impacting the mental health sector positively. How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their application including: A brief introduction about your background in backend development and your passion for mental health technology. Links to your portfolio or examples of prior backend projects, especially those in the health tech domain. Your resume/CV, detailing your professional experiences and technical proficiencies. Your availability for a video interview and possible start date. Join us in transforming mental health care through innovative technology. If you're passionate about backend development and eager to tackle meaningful challenges, we want you to help make Baseline a symbol of hope and progress in the mental health community. Back-End Development Deliverables: Database Integration: Ensure robust integration between our developed database and the web application for real-time data processing and analytics. API Development and Integration: Expand our RESTful API offerings for enhanced connectivity between the application's different components and possibly integrate with third-party services for enriched functionalities. This project not only demands technical excellence but also a dedication to making a significant impact in the mental health domain through technological innovation. We're excited to onboard a backend development expert who shares our commitment to this cause.Skills: MongoDB, Python, API

title: Full-stack development for AI transcription company - Upwork
description: **About Us** We are a new startup in the transcription and content generation industry, offering a comprehensive suite of AI-driven services tailored for content creators. Our platform provides solutions including transcription, summary creation, and much more, designed to enhance the post-production experience for creators. We are currently looking for an outside agency to help maintain and improve our product. **Project Scope** The work can be categorized into two main areas. We’d prefer to find an agency that does BOTH, but will also work with agencies that can work on projects without AI experience. **Product User Experience and Features Implementation**:     - Developing and integrating new features to enhance functionality.     - Ensuring responsive, consistent design used across the platform.     - Refining the user interface and user experience of our existing platform. 2. **(Optional but preferred experience) AI and Machine Learning**:     - Training and improving proprietary AI models to better serve our platform's needs.     - Integrating and optimizing OpenAI Whisper and other models for tasks such as transcription and content generation.     - Innovating and implementing AI-driven features to maintain our competitive edge in the market. **Technical Expertise Required** The selected agency must demonstrate extensive experience with our technology stack, including but not limited to: - **Frontend**: Vue.js/Nuxt.js, Tailwind CSS - **Authentication**: NuxtAuth (Email/Password + Google) - **Backend**: Prisma ORM, PostgreSQL - **Cloud Storage**: AWS S3 for file uploads - **Payments**: Integration with Stripe for billing - **AI and Machine Learning**: Python proficiency, expertise in machine learning, OpenAI Whisper, and general LLMs. Capability to train and improve AI models is crucial. - **Design**: A keen eye for detail, solid understanding of user experience, and high-quality design work. **Ideal Agency Profile** - **Comprehensive Skill Set**: Capable of addressing both the user experience/product features and the AI/machine learning aspects of the project. - **Proven Track Record**: Demonstrated experience in successfully delivering projects with similar technical and creative demands. - **Innovative Mindset**: Commitment to leveraging the latest technologies and methodologies to drive product improvement and innovation. - **Collaborative Approach**: Ability to work closely with our internal team to ensure seamless integration and alignment with our company's vision. - **Solid Communication**: We expect regular attendance to standup meetings to report progress and blocks. Advanced English speaking skills are required. **Upcoming Project Example** One of our upcoming projects on our roadmap is the implementation of an audiogram generator. Here’s how it should work: - Our AI analyzes the audio content to identify the most engaging and shareworthy snippets within the episode. The system then provides users with timestamps for these segments. - With the identified timestamps, the audiogram generator tool should automatically extract the specified audio segments from the main episode. - Users should be able customize the visual aspect of the audiogram, including the placement of text, background images, and video if available. - The resulting audiogram would be a concise, visually engaging snippet, perfect for sharing on social media platforms, websites, or via email to promote the podcast episode and attract a broader audience. **Application Process** We are open to partnerships with agencies specializing in either the product development/user experience domain or the AI/machine learning space. However, preference will be given to companies capable of handling the full spectrum of work described.Skills: Nuxt.js, Vue.js, Tailwind CSS, Web Application, Python, AWS Application, Machine Learning, Transcription Software

title: Art Competition Submission Platform - Upwork
description: Project Overview: This project aims to develop a web platform for an art competition. Participants can submit artwork (photos) through a user-friendly form, while judges can review and approve submissions from a dedicated backend interface. Approved artwork will be displayed publicly in a gallery, while rejected submissions remain hidden. Participants can also manage their profiles and adjust submissions within a limited timeframe. Technical Requirements: Frontend: User-friendly submission form allowing participants to upload a maximum of 3 photos. User registration and login functionality. User profile management where participants can view their submissions and potentially upload additional photos within a designated timeframe (e.g., edit window after initial submission). Public gallery displaying approved artwork. Backend: Secure storage for user data (registration details) and photo submissions. Robust image handling for resizing, compression (optional), and storage. Dedicated judge interface for reviewing submissions with functionalities to approve/reject individual photos. Access control mechanisms to differentiate between participant and judge roles. Integration with a public-facing storage solution (e.g., Cloudinary, Amazon S3) for displaying approved artwork in the gallery (accessible via public URL). Functionality to hide rejected submissions from public view. Tech Stack Recommendations: Frontend: Programming language: ReactJS, AngularJS, or VueJS CSS framework: Bootstrap, Materialize, or Tailwind CSS Backend: Programming language: Python (Django/Flask), NodeJS (Express), PHP (Laravel) Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL Cloud Storage: Cloudinary, Amazon S3 Additional Considerations: User authentication and authorization (secure login) Responsive design for optimal viewing across different devices Image validation (file size, format) Error handling and user feedback mechanisms Implementation timeline and milestones Success Criteria: Functional submission form with photo upload limit User registration and login functionality Secure storage of user data and photos Dedicated judge interface for review and approval Public gallery showcasing approved artwork Participant profile management with limited edit windowSkills: Web Application, Web Development, PHP, HTML

title: Manufacturer Sourcer Video Doorbell and Cameras - Upwork
description: Job Description: We are looking for a Manufacturer Sourcer who can leverage their expertise and network to identify and negotiate with manufacturers capable of producing high-quality video doorbells and cameras. The ideal candidate will possess strong negotiation skills, a keen eye for detail, and a proven track record of sourcing products from China and surrounding areas. Key Responsibilities: • Research and identify potential manufacturers capable of producing video doorbells and cameras to our specifications. • Negotiate pricing, terms, and conditions with manufacturers to ensure cost-effectiveness and quality assurance. • Collaborate with manufacturers to develop custom products and packaging branded with our company logo. • Facilitate the creation of a white-label application for seamless connectivity between our products and cloud storage services. • Ensure that all products and applications are compatible and seamlessly integrated. • Develop contingency plans to mitigate risks and ensure timely delivery of products. Requirements: • Minimum of 10 years of experience in sourcing and negotiating with manufacturers, preferably in the security technology industry. • Proven track record of successfully sourcing and launching products from China and surrounding areas. • Strong negotiation skills and the ability to secure favorable terms and pricing agreements. • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with proficiency in English and Mandarin (preferred). • Detail-oriented with a focus on quality assurance and product integrity. • Ability to manage time effectively and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines. • Experience in creating backup plans to mitigate risks and ensure project success.Skills: Dropshipping, Logistics Coordination, Private Labeling & White Labeling, Product Sourcing, Sourcing, Price & Quote Negotiation, Alibaba Sourcing

title: Product Owner with Technical Background - Upwork
description: Headquartered in Horsens, Denmark, RushFiles A/S is a fast-paced technology company that reinforces corporate data security, file synchronization and collaboration. Counting more than 200,000 active business accounts and a presence in more than 20 countries worldwide, our channel and business partner networks are well alive. Our software turns any datacenter into a hybrid cloud with enterprise grade security features. Enabling service providers to engage directly with B2B customers, we aim to set new standards in corporate collaboration. As a Product Owner at RushFiles, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our products to meet the evolving needs of our global customer base. You will work closely with our development teams to translate customer feedback and business requirements into technical specifications, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions. o What you’ll need to be successful: • Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role in software development, with a strong preference for candidates who have developed .NET applications. • Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and proficiency in Jira. • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to work closely with both developers and customers. • A problem-solver mindset, capable of making decisions that move projects forward. • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, global work environment. o What you’ll be doing: • Serve as the liaison between the development team and customers, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements. • Define product vision and roadmap, working closely with stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment with business goals. • Lead the planning and review sessions to monitor project progress, utilizing Agile methodologies to ensure efficient and effective development. • Collaborate with the development team to define and refine user stories and acceptance criteria, ensuring a seamless development process. • Manage the product backlog, prioritizing based on customer impact and business value. • Facilitate communication across teams to address challenges and ensure the successful delivery of product features. o Nice to have: • Experience file storage & sharing projects. • Experience with channel solutions. • Experience working with Agile and Jira. o What we will hook you up with: • Professional challenge • Career development with focus on technical and personal growth • Competitive salary • A flexible scheduleSkills: Product Roadmap, Agile Project Management, Project Management, Product Backlog

title: Backend Engineer - Data Engineering & Cloud Technologies - Upwork
description: Job Description We seek a highly skilled and motivated Backend Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in data engineering, proficiency in cloud-scale technologies, and a solid command of data structures, algorithms, and multiple programming languages, including Rust, Java, Golang, Julia, JS/TS. Expertise in both relational database management systems (RDBMS) and NoSQL technologies is essential. The candidate should have exposure to data science, enterprise integration design, and experience in building high-scale, low-latency systems. Responsibilities Design, develop, and maintain scalable, high-performance backend systems. Implement robust data pipelines and storage solutions that support complex data processing at scale. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate backend systems with other enterprise systems and applications. Optimize system architecture and framework for maximum speed and scalability. Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with data protection regulations. Goals for the First 12 Months First 30 Days: Onboarding & Integration Familiarize yourself with the company's technology stack, coding standards, and development workflows. Understand the current backend architecture, data models, and key integration points. Start collaborating on small-scale tasks to get acquainted with the codebase and deployment processes. First 60 Days: Contribution & Collaboration Contribute to the development of new features and enhancements for our backend systems. Participate in code reviews and collaborate with the team to maintain high code quality standards. Begin to take on more complex tasks and projects with guidance from senior team members. First 90 Days: System Enhancement & Optimization Lead initiatives to improve system performance, scalability, and reliability. Implement new data engineering techniques and methodologies to enhance data processing capabilities. Evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools to improve product quality and development process. First 180 Days: Leadership & Innovation Demonstrate leadership in the design and development of critical components of our backend systems. Drive innovation by exploring and integrating cutting-edge technologies and frameworks. Mentor junior engineers and contribute to the team's knowledge sharing and skills development. First 12 Months: Strategic Impact & Growth Deliver significant improvements to our backend infrastructure, enabling new capabilities and enhancing user experience. Play a key role in strategic projects and initiatives contributing to the company's long-term success. Establish yourself as a subject matter expert in data engineering and cloud technologies, contributing to the strategic direction of our technology platform. Qualifications Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in data engineering, cloud technologies, and building scalable backend systems. Strong proficiency in Java, Golang, RDBMS, and NoSQL technologies. Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles. Experience with data science and enterprise integration design is a plus. title: Ebook Concept MVP - Upwork
description: MVP Development Brief Objective: Develop an MVP for an innovative eBook concept that empowers users to modify the complexity of textual content within a specific chapter from a well-known public domain story. The app should offer four distinct readability levels: Original Sentence, Simile with Common Quality, Literal Translation, and Clearest Translation. Core Features: Readability Slider: Implement a slider control (or similar functionality) to demonstrate the ability to allow users to dynamically adjust the text's readability level. The adjustment functionality should have four discrete positions, each corresponding to one of the specified readability levels. Interactive Text Display: As the slider is adjusted, the text displayed on the screen should seamlessly transition to the corresponding readability level without reloading the page or causing a noticeable delay to the user. Chapter Selection: If possible, include the functionality to select different sections or chapters of "Alice in Wonderland" for demonstration purposes, assuming the text for at least one chapter is fully adapted to all four readability levels. Technical Requirements: Platform Compatibility: Unless a cheaper alternative can be produced, the MVP should be a web-based application for ease of access and to minimise development costs. title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience  DR111 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: Cybersecurity Management, Security Testing, Vulnerability Assessment, Malware Removal, Cisco ASA, AT&T Cybersecurity, AI Security, Application Security, Firewall, VPN, Encryption, Digital Forensics

title: Engineering consulting for Android 12 and 13 network security protocols - Upwork
description: We are looking for an expert with experience in migrating tablet applications Android 11 to Android 12 & 13, with specific experience disabling network security protocols that block the sharing of network/wifi settings with other devices (experience with VR headsets and Unity is a plus). Our solution requires a tablet application to control and mirror Unity based VR headset applications. We achieve this by using a cloud-based server where the headset and tablet 'meet' and share information. To enable this meeting, the tablet must first log on to a local wifi network, and then share those local wifi details with the headset via wifi direct so that the headset can also get online and connect with the server. The tablet does this by first identifying the headsets that are available locally with manufacturer specific MDNS broadcast and then sharing a cloud-based unique identifier based on the serial number of the tablet using unity's mirror app, and the local SSID that that tablet is on. Under Android 11 our tablet application was able to identify local headsets and share network information easily. That information could be stored and re-used each time after power up and power down. However, under Android 12 and 13, the new network security settings are blocking the sharing of the wifi and network settings. We are looking to find a consultant who has experience disabling the android 12 & 13 network security settings who can provide guidance to our development team on how to best implement changes to our software code as we migrate from Android 11 to 12 and 13. The guidance must be both theoretical and also practical, meaning that the consultant must be able to help our development team write the code required to implement the changes required. This project is one time project, but there is scope for continued work if the candidate is able to demonstrate a clear understanding of the changes required and can communicate an easy and effective strategy for migration.Skills: Network Security, C++, Unity

title: Turbo Fan Engine Performance Equation Restatement due to Avoidance of Fluid Dynamic Constraint  - Upwork
description: We demonstrate an aerodynamic enhancement that achieves an outcome that is repeatable and consistent. The aerodynamic change is consistent with applicable physics, however it introduces an isentropic condition that replaces non isentropic cases.  Demonstration has been done in test cells and in flight operations. Existing turbo machinery code include fluid mechanics constraints that are avoided in this case, and will not normal resolve a solution for the actual performance without altering of other constraints that are not made in the actual tests. The change in performance when considered with the conventional equations for system efficiency including propulsion efficiency and thermodynamic efficiency return problematic results. The existing workaround to explain what the aircraft does is to take known losses from P(ideal), to give an approximation of P(actual), to avoid embarrassment. The mod does not appreciably alter the thermodynamics, but it profoundly alters the propulsion disk performance. The variables at play are limited, only two components of the equations are altered, however the collective change is provable in flight test and the test cell and appears to suggest that a philosophical matter exists. There are distinct differences between propeller and helicopter rotor actuating disk analysis compared to the turbofan case. The turbofan includes pressure ratio v mass-flow constraints that are removed for the fan. This results in far higher thrust for a given case than is otherwise possible. The propeller, rotor and fan all result in a question as to the change in efficiency that is achieved needing to revise the fundamental assumptions of propulsion efficiency that exist. Deliverables: 1. Review of equations of turbomachinery WRT the change that occurs to the demonstrated TSFC and specific thrust achieved. 2. Assess what term of the equations of efficiency are conflicting with the demonstrated change. 3. Determine if an additional variable needs to be included to rationally explain a change such as a 44% increase in thrust measured from an engine that is purported to have a 76% propulsion efficiency.                   Skills: Calculation, Engineering Simulation, ANSYS, Mathematics, MATLAB, Algorithm Development, Mechanical Engineering

description: I'm in the search of a unique FPGA & HFT programmer. My partner in India living off from trading equities ~2 micro HFT. I met him ~1.5 years ago at some random fund to trade crypto. I just search ahead in preparation of this to find the most valuable FPGA developer here (could be you). We are market makers and the structure of dataflow in the system we run (for example on crypto) is the following: All written in C++, running on linux: Websocket (TCP) data | parsing orderbook & trades & order updates let's say for Bitcoin on binance | Running Strategy, decide if we buy or not (we have strategy) | Sending maker orders to buy/sell HTTPS (TCP) or Websocket (TCP). The system logs to files and we get status about trading on Telegram. Now for U.S. equities we would need an FPGA system (where we could plug - in our C++ strategy (I can port that part to HLS). Would be important to use as much C++ as possible, or it can be purely vhdl/verilog if you are able to port strategies from C++. Order management. Structure: NASDAQ TotalView-ITCH 5.0 format market data in (udp) (orderbook & trades & order updates) | strategy running | sending orders via tcp. And some monitoring would be great (only if it costs just nanoseconds). Order managing is heavily part of it that you would need to write with our help. We can provide network capture files (PCAP) for market data, so it can be decoded into (ITCH 5.0) format while you develop locally. We will try to provide help for order status updates and sending too, and everything you need. But we expect autonomy from you in exploring how to test things properly, we are also open to suggestions. We can give a certain profit split instead of fixed budget for the right person. title: Comprehensive cybersecurity audit - Upwork
description: Looking for a professional who can do a remotely operated comprehensive cybersecurity audit for a client. They have a small corporate system with a small server for internal documents a single firewall solution, and google apps for email.  external users also use google apps for email.  It's a simple system but we need a comprehensive audit to present to them.  Some of the things below will not apply, and it's up to you to explain why, or otherwise do the audit for it and report. A comprehensive security audit for a client with 100 remote users, 20 corporate users, and a Ubiquiti firewall would typically include the following components: 1. Network Infrastructure Assessment:    - Review and test the firewall configurations, including rulesets, network segmentation, and access controls.    - Assess the security posture of routers, switches, and other network devices.    - Evaluate the security of wireless networks and access points.    - Analyze the network architecture for potential vulnerabilities and weaknesses. 2. Endpoint Security Assessment:    - Review the security policies and configurations for corporate workstations and servers.    - Assess the patch management and update processes for operating systems and applications.    - Evaluate the deployment and effectiveness of antivirus, anti-malware, and endpoint protection solutions.    - Test for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations in corporate endpoints. 3. Remote User Security Assessment:    - Review the policies and procedures for securing remote user devices.    - Assess the use of virtual private networks (VPNs) or other secure remote access solutions.    - Evaluate the security awareness and training programs for remote users.    - Test for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations in a sample of remote user devices. 4. Application Security Testing:    - Identify and test critical web applications, APIs, and custom software for vulnerabilities like SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and other common web application vulnerabilities.    - Assess the security of authentication and authorization mechanisms.    - Review the secure coding practices and software development life cycle (SDLC) processes. 5. Penetration Testing:    - Perform external and internal penetration testing to identify potential vulnerabilities and weaknesses that could be exploited by attackers.    - Simulate real-world attack scenarios and attempt to gain unauthorized access or escalate privileges.    - Test the effectiveness of security controls and incident response procedures. 6. Data Security Assessment:    - Review data classification and handling practices.    - Assess the encryption mechanisms for data at rest and in transit.    - Evaluate the security of backup and disaster recovery processes. 7. Policy and Compliance Review:    - Review existing security policies, standards, and procedures for adequacy and alignment with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.    - Assess compliance with relevant standards and regulations, such as HIPAA, PCI-DSS, or GDPR, if applicable. 8. Incident Response and Business Continuity Planning:    - Review the incident response plan and procedures for handling security incidents.    - Assess the business continuity and disaster recovery plans for effectiveness and adequacy. 9. Security Awareness and Training:    - Evaluate the effectiveness of security awareness and training programs for employees and remote users.    - Recommend improvements or additional training as needed. 10. Reporting and Recommendations:     - Provide a comprehensive report detailing the findings, vulnerabilities, and risks identified during the audit.     I'm looking for experience please detail your relevant experience.Skills: Security Testing, Cybersecurity Management, Vulnerability Assessment, Penetration Testing, Information Security Audit

I have a vision of building a full-scale mobile app but I want to start very small and prove the market-fit before investing more time and money into the effort. The site should also have some monitoring tool (open to suggestions) that can allow for tracking through the process to help me fine tune the different aspects of the MVP. My desired outcome is a very basic site to allow someone to interact with my agent so that I can learn more about market-fit. title: Product Researcher Ad - Upwork
description:
Are YOU a person with a high level of DRIVE and INITIATIVE? Do YOU want to be part of an ENERGETIC and FAST-GROWING TEAM? If you answered an enthusiastic “YES” to both questions above, KEEP READING.
We are an 8-figure ecommerce brand that sells products for kids in more than 15 countries. We launched the brand at the beginning of 2022 and scaled it from 0 to multiple 7 figures in our first year and did 8 figures in sales in 2023. 
If you're sick of flat lining in your career and ready for growth, apply to join our team now. Our goal is to become a 9-figure brand within the next couple of years and innovate our industry by introducing custom and unique products that will help our customers' lives.
And THAT’S where you come in.
We are looking for a hard-working, resilient, innovative and detail-oriented product researcher that can think outside the box. The goal of this position is to find the best of the best products to build our brand catalog.  
We need someone to take responsibility for:
Researching potential products for our brand;
Perform market research; 
Perform initial product validation;
Report to the Product Development Specialist to align efforts with the brand’s product strategy. 
Position Requirements:
As an organization, we look for the following CORE VALUES in our team members:
Respect: Fundamental to our interactions and relationships is the value of respect. We recognize the inherent worth and dignity of every individual, regardless of their background, beliefs, or position. Our team members are encouraged to treat one another with kindness, understanding, and empathy, creating an environment where everyone feels valued and heard. By upholding respect in all our dealings, we foster a culture of inclusivity, collaboration, and mutual trust, ensuring that every voice is acknowledged and every perspective is considered.
Integrity: We believe in doing the right thing, even when no one is watching. Upholding ethical standards and being honest in all our dealings is non-negotiable. Our team members are expected to act with sincerity and maintain consistency between their words and actions, ensuring that trust is never compromised.
Transparency: We believe that transparency is essential for building a culture of trust and collaboration. We encourage open and honest communication and expect our team members to share feedback, ask questions, and address concerns openly.
Ownership: We value personal accountability and encourage our team members to take ownership of their actions, whether they have been positive or negative. We believe that taking responsibility for one's mistakes and learning from them is critical for personal and professional growth.
Growth Mindset: We never settle. We set goals and achieve them. We believe there is nothing that cannot be achieved, and we expect our team members to always do their best to grow as a person and professionally, and to be eager to grow together with the company. Our team members are encouraged to step out of their comfort zone, embrace new experiences, and view failures as stepping stones to success. By cultivating this mindset, we ensure that individual and organizational growth is always on the horizon.
Hard work: We believe in having a strong work ethic and being committed to achieving excellence. Our team members are encouraged to be productive and continuously improve their skills and knowledge. We believe that this level of dedication and commitment is essential for providing value to our customers and achieving success as a team.
In addition, you MUST have the following skills / experience:
Effective communicator.
Commercial &amp; marketing knowledge.
Deep understanding of e-commerce and physical goods markets. 
Have previous experience in product research  for a D2C brand.
Able to balance creativity and following procedures.
Quick learner.
Capacity to work independently &amp; as a team.
Self-organization skills.
Compensation:
Compensation will be monthly $1500. Up to 50 hours per week, Monday to Saturday.

Fill out this Google Form: https://forms.gle/3AUNRv8AGRWKWTX4A

title: Filipino VA: FULL TIME Google Sheets Data Entry, Research, Scraping (Starts April 15) - Upwork
description: We are a USA based company but you'll mostly be working with Filipinos. This is a stable full-time position. We have VAs that have been with us for years! This position starts April 15th, 2024, Monday. Hours are absolutely non-negotiable, be sure you can do it: - Monday to Friday, 8 hour shifts (40 hours / week) - 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (EST, Eastern Standard Time). That is currently 9 PM to 5AM Philippines Time, part of the year it's 10 PM to 6AM. - Very occasionally if you must miss work, then you may make up the time later such as for an emergency that came up, sickness, etc. After you have been here a while you are allowed to work overtime, over 40 hours. It is not mandatory. **SCHEDULE IS NON-NEGOTIABLE** The ideal candidate must have experience with: - Google Sheets (Basic formula, VLOOKUP, Find and Replace & Sorting) ; Excel knowledge is okay but we use Sheets so that it's easy to share with other staff in our Drive. - Fast Typing Speed 60+ WPM Minimum. - High Speed Internet + Have A Backup Internet For Brown Outs Or Can Show Coffee Shop With Wifi Nearby. Job Details: The tasks will vary so you must be willing to do anything that is needed as we are a small business that is growing fast; however, the work will mostly consist of copying (or scraping) product listings from wholesaler websites into Excel or Sheets. These items then need changed to our specific format (product name, description, price, link, and saving images with associated numbers). We use a .csv Format to upload products into our inventory system and sometimes the source data is way different than how we need it to be, that is why Excel/Sheets experience is a must. We will train you how to translate from source format to our format (how our customers see it). If you have experience working on Excel at all then this is something you can handle. Other work will be general VA work also mostly centered around our inventory systems. Please use the letter Z at the very beginning of your proposal so I know that you read the full listing. Otherwise I do not open your proposal at all. If you have any questions please feel free to ask. We may keep some runner-up applications to be considered for future Upwork job postings. Be sure that your cover letter explains your relevant work history and skills if your profile does not explain. We will NOT agree to any scheduled rate increases, we DO give bonuses and rate increases that are EARNED but only do so at our discretion. We will only interview the candidates that know are qualified. Most importantly, be honest! REQUIRED CHALLENGE / SCENARIO: Display some of your Excel/Sheets knowledge: Given the following scenario, show (screenshot or video) how you would calculate the total cost of each SKU given the quantity you need, and your total cost for the order. You are planning to buy 7 item SKUs online. You have Column A: Product Name. Column B has the product cost per quantity of the SKU, and Column C has the quantity. It doesn't matter what the product costs and quantities are but make each cell down the respective columns differ... In other words, make your own (unique) inputs. You may use additional columns, rows, etc as needed.Skills: Computer Skills, Google Sheets

title: RBAC Nest.js | Prisma CASL | TypeScript - Upwork
description: ## About us We are an API aggregator company specializing in game-tech and fintech solutions. Our platform offers seamless headless integration, enabling clients to access a diverse range of games and financial services through a single, unified API. We are committed to providing innovative, secure, and scalable solutions that empower businesses to expand their offerings and enhance user experiences. Our mission is to simplify complex integrations and drive growth for our clients in the digital landscape. ## About the contract (issues) ## Business requirements Implement a flexible role-based access control (RBAC) system with the following considerations: - Allow for the creation of custom roles with specific permissions. - Enable fine-grained control over what each staff member can access and do. We have the following roles in our system: - Superadmin (platform owner/staff) - Workspace owner - Workspace member - Affiliate - Affiliate child (n levels -- only can see their own records) ## Functional - Role Management: Develop a system for creating and managing custom roles with specific permissions. - Access Control: Implement access control logic that determines access based on the user's assigned role and its associated permissions. ### Non-functional -The RBAC system should be scalable and easily extendable to accommodate future changes. -The implementation should ensure security and prevent unauthorized access. ## Our tech stacks and backend toolings: NX monorepo Nest.js / Express GraphQL Yoga Server / Apollo Playground Prisma / Prisma GQL Generator ## We are looking for a backend developer with solid experience in the following: - Be skilled in implementing role-based access control systems. Have experience with designing and managing custom roles and permissions. - Understand the principles of API design and development. - Be familiar with security best practices in a Nest.js environment. ## Your proposal: Submit a detailed technical proposal plan for implementing the flexible RBAC system, emphasizing the management of custom roles, fine-grained access control, and security considerations. Additionally, describing your experience with similar access control projects, including specific challenges you've addressed and how those experiences inform your approach to this project, would be highly valuable. You must post a proposal for how you will implement the requirements mentioned above. Your proposal should include a technical explanation of the changes you will make. You are not required to submit the final solution or code along with your proposal. Your proposal will be reviewed. If your proposal is accepted, you should post the proposal on Upwork and you will be hired for the job. AFTER your proposal is accepted on Upwork and you have accepted the offer, access to GitHub will be granted and you may begin the work. You will create a pull request in our repository to merge your code into our codebase. Include screenshots and confirmation that you have tested the pull request. Our engineers will review the code, and approve and merge when the code meets our requirements.Skills: GraphQL, TypeScript, NestJS

Excellent communication skills to effectively gather requirements and provide training/documentation for the system. A problem-solving mindset with attention to detail, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of the audit reporting system. Project Deliverables: A fully customizable Google Forms tool for site-specific audit data collection. A secure and scalable master file system with restricted access controls for team members and individual, secure reports for customers. title: Marketing Agency Client "Portal" Setup (SuiteDash?) - Upwork
description: We are a digital marketing agency that needs to improve our client experience. We would like to build-out a client portal too improve communications, assigning to-do's to the client, helping them stay organized with what we need from them, and giving them an all-in-one place to go to for our engagement. We are currently looking at SuiteDash as a solution. If you have experience with this, please let us know in your proposal. Some of the features we need: - Client communication/messaging - send & receive messages, preferably organized in threads about specific tasks/items. - Client to-do's & tasks - ability to create & assign tasks to clients where they can EASILY see, complete, and organize their "homework" from us. Things like "send over your branding kit" or "upload your webinar PowerPoint" by xx due dates. - Client uploads - easily upload/send over things needed in an organized folder structure. - Client engagement details - each client can view the details of their engagement with us, agreements, etc. - Onboarding forms - if possible - client can fill out & submit a series of onboarding forms prior to scheduling their 1st call with us in the engagement. We currently have this built out in JotForm and HighLevel with automations in Make.com. - Support & Needs Forms - ability for clients to quickly send in support request or a new need (like a new marketing campaign details). - Integrations - connect to our other programs (like ClickUp & HighLevel) via Make, Zap, or API. We want to avoid a completely custom development/build-out if possible. However, if it is something that can be done within a reasonable budget & timeframe, then we may be open to that. Each client should have their own area, with their own unique tasks, details, etc. We can absolutely template-ize this for new clients coming in so it's not a custom set up each time. We would like to find a pre-built platform to accomplish this (like SuiteDash).Skills: Customer Onboarding, Customer Portal, Customer Data Platform, Business Operations, Business Process Automation, Business Process Management, Customer Relationship Management, Business Process Management Software

We're looking for a designer to create 3 main screens of the Text to Speech app, based on well-defined mockups. If it turns out we like the design, you'll be hired to complete all ~15 screens of the app and may be to design more apps for us later! Below are descriptions of main screens and their functionality: 1. Library Screen - a screen where user sees or can add new files: - Add files to the library button (+): When pressed, opens a list of ways to add files. - Button to go to the app settings. - Button to go to the instant text-to-speech screen (intended to assist communication for users with voice impairments). - List of files and folders: Displays added files and folders with the ability to manage them. To listen to the files, they need to be added and saved in the library. 2. File screen - a screen where user can listen to files Field with title and main text of the file: Displays the title and main text of the selected file from the library. Function menu button (in the top right corner): Pressing it opens a menu with the following functions: Edit text (delete/add). Selecting this option brings up the keyboard. Change text appearance (change font size). Offers a choice of 3 options: Small, Medium, Large. Export to MP3 (paid feature). " Library" button (in the top left corner): Pressing it navigates back to the library / folder. Player at the bottom of the screen: Plays the text's audio file with control over playback, choice of language and voice (navigates to the Choose a Voice screen), and setting of playback speed (opens the Select Speed modal window). Shows the reading progress of the text and allows navigation through the text. 3. Paywall - a subscription payment screen. Looking forward to hear from you!Skills: iOS

title: Expert Developer for Integrating AI Voice Pizza Ordering System with Clover POS - Upwork
description: Job Title: Expert Developer for Integrating AI Pizza Ordering System with Clover POS Overview: We are looking for a talented software developer or a dedicated development team to integrate and prompt an advanced pizza ordering system. Our project aims to provide a seamless and interactive ordering experience, leveraging conversational AI and real-time inventory management. We have already established accounts with Retell AI, Clover API, Azure OpenAI, and Twilio API and need your expertise to bring these components together into a cohesive, efficient ordering system. Project Scope: Integrate an existing suite of APIs (Retell AI for voice recognition and text-to-speech, Azure OpenAI for natural language understanding, Twilio for telephony, and Clover POS for payment processing) into a unified pizza ordering system. Implement a real-time inventory management system that integrates seamlessly with the conversational AI to provide up-to-date menu options and ingredient availability. Ensure the system is scalable, secure, and capable of handling high volumes of orders with precision and reliability. Key Responsibilities: Develop and configure the integration of Retell AI, Clover API, Azure OpenAI, and Twilio API to create a seamless ordering process. Design the logic and flow for conversational interactions that guide customers through the pizza ordering process, including menu navigation, customization, and payment. Work with the real-time inventory management system to ensure that the AI's recommendations reflect the current stock levels. Build a secure and scalable backend infrastructure to support the application, ensuring data privacy and system reliability. Collaborate with stakeholders to refine the user experience and optimize the system based on feedback and performance metrics. Skills and Qualifications: Proven experience in API integration, particularly with Retell AI, Clover, Azure OpenAI, and Twilio. Strong background in developing conversational AI applications and understanding of natural language processing technologies. Expertise in database management and real-time data processing, preferably with experience in inventory systems. Familiarity with secure payment processing standards and experience integrating POS systems, especially Clover. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Effective communication skills for liaising with team members and stakeholders. What We Offer: The opportunity to work on a cutting-edge project at the intersection of AI and the food service industry. Competitive compensation reflective of your expertise and the critical role you will play in this project. Flexible working hours and potential for ongoing involvement in the project's future phases or other company initiatives. Application Process: Please submit your resume, portfolio (highlighting relevant API integration projects and conversational AI applications), and a cover letter explaining why you are the perfect fit for this project. Be sure to mention any direct experience with Retell AI, Clover, Azure OpenAI, and Twilio API integrations.Skills: AI Agent Development, AI Development, AI Bot, API, Python, API Integration

title: Mobile app with AI voice generation - Upwork
description: Hi! We're looking for developers (ideally part of an agency or team) with experience in no-code or low-code solutions, as well as AI. We would like you to have team members with different expertises, or have experience sub-contracting some specific components of the app so it all integrates smoothly. The basic idea of the app is that someone can answer a quiz-style conversation with AI, and using the answers from the quiz, the custom AI model will generate a personalized meditation for that person. The meditation will be converted to audio with text-to-speech AI in real time (that's the only component that will be generated in real time). The text-to-speach audio will then be paired with a music background from an existent library, and an option to hear the resulting meditation using a VR headset and a 360 background like this: https://momento360.com/e/u/6c58864ab2314d758d386ab60125b87f I have researched the separate components needed for the app to work, and how much would they cost based on good rated fixed projects here on Upwork. This is the estimated list of costs for the elements I came up with: Project management - 200usd App design from no-code template - 300 usd Custom (trainable) AI model to generate meditation texts - 350 usd 33 AI generated music backgrounds - 50 usd 7 AI customized voices for text-to-speech - 70 usd AI voice integration for real-time audio generation within the app - 200 usd 33 AI generated 360 images for VR visualization - 50 usd Android VR conversion to upload a version of the app to Meta Quest Appstore, or... and audio embedder and QR generator for the option to listen to meditations on external website that supports 360 background view with a VR headset: 100-300 usd App upload to stores: 100 usd Extra debugging or software license costs: 180 usd Total: 1,800 usd It's all about working with pre-existing technologies, so we're not looking for expert builders of original code, rather creative and pro-active project managers, who can integrate different components and outsource what their own team can't do. We're looking at a timeline of 8-12 weeks once the contract starts. But if you want to propose a higher cost in any category, or you need more time, we're open to it. We are willing to pay more if you show us you or your agency are extremely efficient and can get this done in whatever timeline that you commit to do so. Thanks for your proposals!Skills: Android, Artificial Intelligence, Mobile App Development, iOS

title: I want a clone of the software behind ElevenLabs  Voice Clonging Technology  - Upwork
description: Looking to develop a clone of ElevenLabs AI voice cloning for text to voice generation. I am looking for a proposal for something that is on par with their product. Not an MVP or some half backed prototype. The real deal. Please do not waste my time if this is not possible. Relevant skills include: Deep Learning Models: They probably use deep neural networks, such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or recurrent neural networks (RNNs), specifically Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks, for processing audio signals and capturing temporal dependencies in speech. Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs): GANs could be used for generating realistic-sounding speech by training two neural networks against each other, one generating audio and the other evaluating its authenticity. WaveNet or Tacotron: These are specific types of neural network architectures developed by Google for text-to-speech synthesis that could be adapted for voice cloning. WaveNet, in particular, is known for its ability to generate natural-sounding speech. Voice Conversion Techniques: Techniques like voice conversion and speaker adaptation might be used to modify the characteristics of a source speaker's voice to match those of a target speaker. Natural Language Processing (NLP): NLP techniques could be used to analyze and understand the text that needs to be converted into speech, ensuring that the generated speech has the correct pronunciation, intonation, and emotion. Audio Processing Libraries: Libraries like Librosa or PyAudio could be used for audio signal processing, feature extraction, and manipulation. Frameworks and Libraries: They might use popular machine learning and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras for building and training their models.Skills: API, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP Tokenization

title: ProseMirror editor front end development - Upwork
description: Project Overview: We are seeking an experienced Frontend Developer with expertise in ProseMirror to develop a custom web-based application designed for editing XML marked texts and creating an SSML (Speech Synthesis Markup Language) editor. This project is aimed at enabling users to interact with, translate, and modify texts while ensuring the integrity of XML/SSML tags. The application will serve as a powerful tool for content creators working with Azure TTS (Text-to-Speech) by providing visual editing capabilities for SSML parameters and tags. Key Responsibilities: Design and develop a web-based text editor using ProseMirror tailored for editing XML marked texts. Implement functionality to allow users to interact with and translate texts without altering the underlying XML/SSML structure. Create visual editing tools within the ProseMirror framework for adding, modifying, and reviewing SSML tags and attributes, specifically designed for Azure TTS editing. Ensure the integrity of tags and their positions post user interactions, including a robust review mechanism to check for errors or inconsistencies in the markup. Collaborate with the project team to define requirements, user stories, and deliverables. Provide documentation and user guides for the developed application, including usage scenarios and troubleshooting. Implement responsive design principles to ensure the application is accessible across various devices and platforms. Work closely with backend developers to integrate the ProseMirror editor with existing systems and APIs for data exchange and processing. Qualifications: Strong experience with JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3. Proven track record of working with ProseMirror or similar JavaScript-based text editors. Familiarity with XML and SSML standards, especially in the context of Azure TTS. Understanding of web application development frameworks and technologies. Experience with RESTful APIs and asynchronous request handling. Ability to write clean, maintainable, and efficient code. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Previous experience in creating text editing tools or working with rich text editors is highly desirable. Project Details: This is a project-based, freelance position. Remote candidates are welcome. Project duration and milestones will be discussed and agreed upon before the commencement of the project. Compensation will be project-based, negotiated based on experience, skills, and project specifics. Application Process: Please submit your resume, along with a portfolio showcasing relevant projects, particularly any experience with ProseMirror, XML/SSML editing, or text editing tools development. Include a brief cover letter explaining why you're the best fit for this project, your availability, and your rate expectations. We're looking forward to creating an innovative tool that enhances text editing and translation workflows, and we believe your contribution will be key to our success.Skills: TypeScript, Angular, JavaScript

description: [Note: To give priority to genuine applicants, any ChatGPT-generated proposals or spammers will be instantly declined / reported.] This is a straightforward task if you have worked previously with TCP sockets or Websockets. **BACKGROUND:** RealtimeSTT (https://github.com/KoljaB/RealtimeSTT) is an open-source Python codebase that does speech-to-text transcription. title: Integrate Deepgram STT API into our React Web App - Upwork
description: We have a voice-enabled web app powered by conversational AI. Check it out: https://digital-friends.com/?character=Heath Built on React and hosted on EC2, our web app communicates via Twilio through a designated phone number. The LLM API, responsible for response generation, is provided by InWorld, and is currently handling both Text-to-Speech (TTS) and Speech-to-Text (STT). To achieve faster response times and lower latency, we want to replace the STT and TTS libraries and continue to use the InWorld for LLM (text responses). Job is to integrate: Deepgram (STT) https://developers.deepgram.com/docs/getting-started-with-live-streaming-audio#write-the-code and https://github.com/KoljaB/RealtimeTTS (Python) Then flow will become: 1. User speaks to AI with voice on device 2. Deepgram transcribes that streaming audio to Text 3. Text is sent to InWorld 4. InWorld returns a text response 5. RealtimeTTS turns that text response to audio (with ElevenLabs) This new flow will bypass InWorld's processing of STT and TTS, with the goal of speeding up response times. This is a paid trial project to find more members for our team for ongoing work.Skills: Python, React, Node.js, API Integration, API

title: Backend Low-latency API leveraging GPT, Whisper, Elevenlabs and Twilio - Upwork
description: We are embarking on an exciting project to develop a cutting-edge API that leverages the capabilities of AI technologies including GPT-4 Turbo, Whisper for speech-to-text, Elevenlabs for text-to-speech, and Twilio for communications. Our goal is to create a seamless and efficient backend system that will serve a client application designed to facilitate real-time voice interactions with advanced AI features. Project Overview: The core functionality of our API includes converting text to speech using Elevenlabs, transcribing speech to text with Whisper, generating intelligent responses via GPT-4 Turbo, and handling phone calls, including recording and potentially triggering actions (e.g., webhooks, calendar integrations), through Twilio. The backend must be built using a fast programming language such as Go, Java with Spring Boot, or Node.js (with careful consideration to minimise latency) with Nestjs being the framework. We emphasise the importance of a relational database, specifically PostgreSQL, integrated through Prisma ORM to ensure efficient data handling and scalability. Requirements: Senior Backend Engineer with extensive experience in developing high-performance APIs, preferably with exposure to AI technologies and communication platforms like Twilio. Proficiency in Go, Java with Spring Boot, or Node.js. The choice of language should align with our need for low-latency, high-efficiency backend services. Experience with PostgreSQL and Prisma ORM, ensuring robust and scalable database design and management. Capability to produce comprehensive Swagger API documentation and a commitment to fully tested code, including unit and end-to-end tests, to guarantee reliability and quality of the API. Knowledge or willingness to explore serverless architectures versus traditional deployments (e.g., AWS ECS) to determine the most effective setup for minimizing cold starts while maintaining scalability and performance. Project Stages: Proof of Concept (POC): Initially, we require a POC to demonstrate the feasibility of achieving low latency in real-time voice interactions, addressing any potential technical hurdles upfront. Full-Scale Development: Upon successful validation of the POC, the project will transition into full-scale development, expanding on the initial framework to build out the complete set of features and integrations. Why Join Us? This project offers the opportunity to work on the forefront of AI and communication technology, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in real-time interaction applications. We provide a collaborative environment where innovation is at the heart of everything we do, supported by a team that values creativity and the implementation of cutting-edge technologies. Application Process: If you are a visionary Backend Engineer with the skills and passion to contribute to a pioneering project, we would love to hear from you. Please send your resume, portfolio of relevant projects, and a brief cover letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for this role. We look forward to potentially having you on our team and creating something truly revolutionary together.Skills: PostgreSQL, Software Architecture & Design, Database Architecture, Golang, SaaS, Spring Framework, API, Twilio API, Java, Node.js

title: Twilio Stream - Websocket Audio Queue Management (FFmpeg) - Upwork
description: Summary: Attached is a TypeScript file, `call-media-queue.ts`. This class queues and sends audio to Twilio via a websocket. Your job is to extend the class to support real-time background audio. 1. Add an argument in the constructor `backgroundAudioPath`, then load this file in via `fs`. 2. Begin sending the audio in chunks to Twilio via `media` websocket messages. Twilio plays audio messages in the order in which they were received, so you'll want to send `mark` messages to receive a `mark` event when playback for your send messages has completed. Continue sending and maintaining current playback position until the class receives a new `media` message. 3. Upon receiving a new `media` message, get the current playtime of the background audio, then use ffmpeg (or another solution, if better) to merge the audio. You'll want to trim the background audio at it's current playback position, then merge it from there based on the duration of the new audio message (typically a few ms). 4. Send the merged data to Twilio. Once playback of the merged audio is complete, continue sending the background audio at it's current play position. Keep in mind the latency of processing merged audio using ffmpeg as this may change how audio sounds. Also note that audio sent into the class must be merged and sent sequentially. Please test with Twilio web sockets, docs here: https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/twiml/stream Goals: 1. Background audio should sound continuous to end-users, without interruption. 2. Input audio (text-to-speech audio) should seamlessly merge over background audio. 3. This solution is for a realtime voice phone system, so keep latency as close to zero as possible. Required Skills and Qualifications: - Strong proficiency in TypeScript and Node.js. - Experience with real-time audio processing and streaming. - Familiarity with Twilio's APIs, particularly for audio streaming. - Proficiency in using ffmpeg and ffprobe for audio manipulation. - Experience with WebSocket communication. - Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. - Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Desirable Skills: - Previous experience with audio queue management systems. - Knowledge of audio file formats and codecs, particularly WAV and u-law. - Experience with stream-based audio processing in Node.js.Skills: Twilio API, Node.js, API Integration

title: Looking for a passionate AI developer to outline my chatbot app idea - Upwork
description: Hi there, I am working on an idea to build an emotional support chatbot app that can be a friend to people. I want to train the GPT to be motivational, give good relationship advice, help people to go through the day-to-day life, etc. Before you continue reading, I am looking for someone passionate and curious about new things in AI, and who can be a companion to me in exploring AI to help people with our product. If you are only interested in taking on more projects and making good money, this posting won't indulge you. ----- I currently use GPT 3.5 with little to no customization, and I know that much more complex and personalized things can be done using ready huggingface models, etc. I managed to build a  Telegram BOT using make.com automation(similar to Zapier) 1. The user can send text & and voice messages - If text is voice message, I turn voice to text using Eden.AI 2. Then converted speech(prompt) is sent to stack-ai to the instructed model. I instructed the model using 4 motivational speech videos from YouTube, and put that kind of customization there - https://ibb.co/1TZWVks 3. GPT 3.5 responses are being converted to speech(using ElevenLabs API), and sent to the user via voice message. --- I can say that the responses are quite good, but I have too many questions about how we can improve it. For example: 1. Currently all prompts are answered in a motivational way(because it's the only instruction is given) - I am curious how we can understand the context of the prompt, and then redirect that prompt to the specific trained model Let's say, the question(prompt) is about how to handle the relationship with the user's boyfriend/girlfriend. In that case, instead of using "motivational GPT", we can use the "relationship GPT" which is trained with the texts of relationship experts. I have many more questions like that. So if you think that you want to explore these things with me, we can work together, I don't need you to code anything now, I am going to outline the all features of the project after I have the theoretical knowledge. Then we can discuss developing the project.Skills: Artificial Intelligence, GPT API, GPT-4, GPT-4 API, LLM Prompt Engineering, Chatbot Prompt

title: AI / Text to Speech Dev/PM expert needed for an exciting project - Upwork
description: Are you a sharp-minded individual with experience in AI text and speech and an appetite for challenge? This is your chance to be part of something big. Our founder, who previously spearheaded a company that achieved over $100 million in sales with a thriving team of 100, is venturing into new territory, and we're assembling an A-team to make waves together. Our new application is going to revolutionize language learning. All existing language learning methods require the student to allocate time out of their busy day to dedicate to being engaged with content that they don't care about. Our pioneer approach would allow the student to learn the language using the content they are already excited about consuming. We are looking for a highly technical product manager or a highly communicative, independent and organized developer. Take a look at the questions below. If you have experience with such challenges and are interested in learning more, drop us a line and we will share more information about the challenges and the position. 1. Recording a single word on an audio file with the right intonation: How would you record a short audio file that includes only a single word but that this word is read with the intonation of a word in a sentence. Examples: 1. provide an audio file that has the word 'please', as read  from the sentence "Would you please put that phone down". 2. provide an audio file that has the word 'please', as read from the sentence "can you move, please?" The solution should be scalable and allow us to record many words. Notice, that the naive solution would be to record each sentence using AI, and cut out the word 'please' to save it as a separate file, but for that we would need a reliable solution that would identify the word in the longer audio and will know the exact timestamp of the start of the word and of the end of the word, so that the output file won't have any leftovers from the previous or following word, and won't cut any part of the target word out.. On the other hand, if we naively used a TTS application and recorded the word please by itself, it wouldn't necessarily have the right intonation that we need. Project based or full time based work is available. Bonuses and Equity are available for long term contributors.Skills: Artificial Intelligence, Product Management, Software Development
